title: 106_s1330
content: The conveyance of land to the City of Mesquite, Nevada is outlined in Section 1. Section 3 of Public Law 99-548 is amended to grant the city of Mesquite, Nevada exclusive rights to purchase specified parcels of public land for 12 years. The described land includes portions of sections 27, 28, and 29 in T. 13 S., R. 70 E., Mount Diablo Meridian, Nevada. The city of Mesquite, Nevada has exclusive rights to purchase specified parcels of public land for 12 years. The land includes portions of sections 27, 28, and 29 in T. 13 S., R. 70 E., Mount Diablo Meridian, Nevada. Additionally, certain sections in T. 14 S., R. 70 E., and T. 13 S., R. 69 E. are also designated for specific land use. In T. 13 S., R. 69 E., Mount Diablo Meridian, Nevada, certain sections are designated for purchase by the city of Mesquite. The city must notify the Secretary of their intent to purchase specified parcels of public land within 10 years. The city of Mesquite intends to purchase specified parcels of public land, which the Secretary must convey within 1 year of notification. The land is withdrawn from entry and appropriation for 12 years, and proceeds from the sale will be deposited into a special account. The Nevada Public Land Management Act of 1998 requires the Secretary to convey up to 2,560 acres of public land to the city of Mesquite, Nevada within 1 year. The specified parcels of land are withdrawn from entry and proceeds from the sale will be deposited into a special account. The Nevada Public Land Management Act of 1998 mandates the conveyance of specific land parcels to Mesquite, Nevada. The designated areas are withdrawn from entry and sales proceeds go into a special account. In T. 14 S., R. 68 E., Mount Diablo Meridian, Nevada, specific land parcels in Sec. 1 and Sec. 12 are withdrawn from entry and appropriation for 12 years. The Senate passed the bill on November 19, 1999.
